page.title: 11WOKINGHAM _ CUSTOMS
page.content: The{market}in Wokingham started over 700 years ago acquiring a reputation for fat fowls. A change occured in the late 19th century when the market became renowned for poultry but then began to decline. This {decline}was increased by the out break of World War Two but the market still sells cheese, eggs, fish and vegetables today. The annual Wokingham {Carnival} was first held in 1929 with all the proceeds going towards local charities. The event is still held at the Cantley ground and attracts a large proportion of the community. Scouts and Guides parade through the town on St Georges Day and on other special occasions. There are also frequent {parades }by the youth groups in the towns churches.
